Package org.cesecore.certificates.ca

Class CaSessionBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CaSessionBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CaSession, CaSessionLocal, CaSessionRemote
    public class CaSessionBean
extends Object
implements CaSessionLocal, CaSessionRemote
    Implementation of CaSession, i.e takes care of all CA related CRUD operations.
    Version:
    $Id: CaSessionBean.java 29306 2018-06-21 14:07:02Z andresjakobs $

      Method returning id's of all CA's available to the system that the administrator is authorized to, Does not log access control to all CAs it checks, because this does not give access to the CAs but only returns IDs of CAs.

      Method returning info objects for all CA's available to the system that the administrator is authorized to.
      Collection<String> getAuthorizedCaNames​(AuthenticationToken admin)
      Method returning names of all CA's available to the system that the administrator is authorized to, Does not log access control to all CAs it checks, because this does not give access to the CAs but only returns names of CAs.

      Like CaSession.getAuthorizedCaNames(AuthenticationToken), but returns a TreeMap which includes the CA Id as well.

      • addCA

                  CA ca)
           throws CAExistsException,
                  AuthorizationDeniedException
        Description copied from interface: CaSession
        Adds a CA to the database
        Specified by:
        addCA in interface CaSession
        Parameters:

        ca - the CA to add
        Throws:
        CAExistsException - if CA already exists
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if not authorized to add CA

      • editCA

        public void editCA​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                   CAInfo cainfo)
            throws CADoesntExistsException,
                   AuthorizationDeniedException
        Description copied from interface: CaSession
        Changes a CA in the database. Can change mostly everything except caid, caname and subject DN. When editing a CA the CA token will usually be taken off line. So you need to activate the CA token after editing, if auto-activation of the CA token is not enabled. There's also CAAdminSession.editCA() which handles some special cases, e.g. changing the Subject DN of uninitialized CAs.
        Specified by:
        editCA in interface CaSession
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        cainfo - the CAInfo to change values of the CA
        Throws:
        CADoesntExistsException - If CA not found
        AuthorizationDeniedException - If access denied

      • editCA

        public void editCA​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                   CA ca,
                   boolean auditlog)
            throws CADoesntExistsException,
                   AuthorizationDeniedException
        Description copied from interface: CaSessionLocal
        Changes a CA in the database. Can change mostly everything except caid, caname and subject DN. When editing a CA the CA token will usually be taken off line. So you need to activate the CA token after editing, if auto-activation of the CA token is not enabled.
        Specified by:
        editCA in interface CaSessionLocal
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        ca - the CA to edit
        auditlog - if audit logging of the edit should be done or not, not needed if called from other internal methods that already does audit logging.
        Throws:
        CADoesntExistsException - If CA not found
        AuthorizationDeniedException - If access denied

                                throws AuthorizationDeniedException
        Description copied from interface: CaSessionLocal
        Checks if at least one CA references a key validator.
        Specified by:

      • getCA

        public CA getCA​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                int caid)
         throws AuthorizationDeniedException
        Description copied from interface: CaSessionLocal
        Get the CA object performing the regular authorization check. Checks if the CA has expired or the certificate isn't valid yet and in that case sets the correct CA status. NOTE: This method will return a shared CA object from a cache. Not suitable for reading a CA object that you plan to edit. Use this when you need to use the CA, since it's faster. User getCAForEdit if you want to edit the CA object and does not want your changes to be overwritten by another thread.
        Specified by:
        getCA in interface CaSessionLocal
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        caid - identifies the CA (CertTools.stringToBCDNString(StringTools.strip(caSubjectDN)).hashCode())
        Returns:
        the CA object, or null if it doesn't exist.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if not authorized to get CA
        See Also:
        CaSessionLocal.getCAForEdit(AuthenticationToken, String)

      • getCA

        public CA getCA​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                String name)
         throws AuthorizationDeniedException
        Description copied from interface: CaSessionLocal
        Get the CA object performing the regular authorization check. Checks if the CA has expired or the certificate isn't valid yet and in that case sets the correct CA status. NOTE: This method will return a shared CA object from a cache. Not suitable for reading a CA object that you plan to edit. Use this when you need to use the CA, since it's faster. User getCAForEdit if you want to edit the CA object and does not want your changes to be overwritten by another thread.
        Specified by:
        getCA in interface CaSessionLocal
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        name - name of the CA that we are searching for
        Returns:
        CA value object, or null if it doesn't exist.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if not authorized to get CA
        See Also:
        CaSessionLocal.getCAForEdit(AuthenticationToken, String)

      • getCANoLog

        public CA getCANoLog​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                     int caid)
              throws AuthorizationDeniedException
        Description copied from interface: CaSessionLocal
        Internal (local only) method to get the CA object without logging the authorization check. (the auth check is performed though) NOTE: This method will return a shared CA object from a cache. Not suitable for reading a CA object that you plan to edit. Use this when you need to use the CA, since it's faster. User getCAForEdit if you want to edit the CA object and does not want your changes to be overwritten by another thread.
        Specified by:
        getCANoLog in interface CaSessionLocal
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        caid - identifies the CA (CertTools.stringToBCDNString(StringTools.strip(caSubjectDN)).hashCode())
        Returns:
        the CA object, or null if it doesn't exist.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if not authorized to get CA
        See Also:
        CaSessionLocal.getCAForEdit(AuthenticationToken, String)

      • getCAForEdit

        public CA getCAForEdit​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                       int caid)
                throws AuthorizationDeniedException
        Description copied from interface: CaSessionLocal
        Get the CA object performing the regular authorization check. Checks if the CA has expired or the certificate isn't valid yet and in that case sets the correct CA status. NOTE: This method will return a new CA object from the database. Not suitable for reading a CA object that you plan to simply use. Use this when you need to edit the CA object, since it's slower. User getCA if you want to simply use the CA object and does not need to make edits.
        Specified by:
        getCAForEdit in interface CaSessionLocal
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        caid - identifies the CA (CertTools.stringToBCDNString(StringTools.strip(caSubjectDN)).hashCode())
        Returns:
        CA value object, or null if it doesn't exist.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if not authorized to get CA
        See Also:
        CaSessionLocal.getCA(AuthenticationToken, String)

      • getCAForEdit

        public CA getCAForEdit​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                       String name)
                throws AuthorizationDeniedException
        Description copied from interface: CaSessionLocal
        Get the CA object performing the regular authorization check. Checks if the CA has expired or the certificate isn't valid yet and in that case sets the correct CA status. NOTE: This method will return a new CA object from the database. Not suitable for reading a CA object that you plan to simply use. Use this when you need to edit the CA object, since it's slower. User getCA if you want to simply use the CA object and does not need to make edits.
        Specified by:
        getCAForEdit in interface CaSessionLocal
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        name - name of the CA that we are searching for
        Returns:
        CA value object, or null if it doesn't exist.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if not authorized to get CA
        See Also:
        CaSessionLocal.getCA(AuthenticationToken, String)

      • getCAInfoInternal

        public CAInfo getCAInfoInternal​(int caid)
        Description copied from interface: CaSessionLocal
        Internal (local only) method for getting CAInfo, to avoid access control logging for internal operations. Note! No authorization checks performed in this internal method
        Specified by:
        getCAInfoInternal in interface CaSessionLocal
        Parameters:
        caid - numerical id of CA (CertTools.stringToBCDNString(StringTools.strip(caSubjectDN)).hashCode()) that we search for
        Returns:
        CA value object, or null if it doesn't exist.

      • getCaChain

        public Collection<CertificateWrapper> getCaChain​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                                                 String caName)
                                          throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                                                 CADoesntExistsException
        Description copied from interface: CaSession
        Fetches the current certificate chain for a CA. 
         Authorization requirements:
 - /administrator
 - /ca/<ca in question>
        Specified by:
        getCaChain in interface CaSession
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - administrator calling the method
        caName - the unique name of the CA whose certificate chain should be returned.
        Returns:
        a list of X509 Certificates or CVC Certificates with the root certificate last, or an empty list if the CA's status is "Waiting for certificate response".
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if the client does not fulfill the authorization requirements specified above.
        CADoesntExistsException - if the CA with the CA name given as input does not exist.

      • getCAInfoInternal

        public CAInfo getCAInfoInternal​(int caid,
                                String name,
                                boolean fromCache)
        Description copied from interface: CaSessionLocal
        Internal (local only) method for getting CAInfo, to avoid access control logging for internal operations. Tries to find the CA even if the CAId is wrong due to CA certificate DN not being the same as CA DN. Note! No authorization checks performed in this internal method
        Specified by:
        getCAInfoInternal in interface CaSessionLocal
        Parameters:
        caid - numerical id of CA (CertTools.stringToBCDNString(StringTools.strip(caSubjectDN)).hashCode()) that we search for, or -1 if a name is to be used instead
        name - human readable name of CA, used instead of caid if caid == -1, can be null if caid != -1
        fromCache - if we should use the CA cache or return a new, decoupled, instance from the database, to be used when you need a completely distinct object, for edit, and not a shared cached instance.
        Returns:
        CA value object, or null if it doesn't exist.

      • removeCA

        public void removeCA​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                     int caid)
              throws AuthorizationDeniedException
        Description copied from interface: CaSession
        Method used to remove a CA from the system. You should first check that the CA isn't used by any EndEntity, Profile or AccessRule before it is removed. CADataHandler for example makes this check. Should be used with care. If any certificate has been created with the CA use revokeCA instead and don't remove it.
        Specified by:
        removeCA in interface CaSession
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        caid - numerical unique id of CA If the CA does not exist, nothing happens the method return silently.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if not authorized to remove CA

      • renameCA

        public void renameCA​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                     String oldname,
                     String newname)
              throws CAExistsException,
                     CADoesntExistsException,
                     AuthorizationDeniedException
        Description copied from interface: CaSession
        Renames the short name of CA (used in administrators interfaces). This name does not have to be the same as SubjectDN and is only used for reference.
        Specified by:
        renameCA in interface CaSession
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        oldname - the name of the CA to rename
        newname - the new name of the CA
        Throws:
        CAExistsException - if the CA with newname already exists
        CADoesntExistsException - if the CA with oldname does not exist
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if not authorized to rename CA

      • getAuthorizedAndEnabledCaInfos

        public List<CAInfo> getAuthorizedAndEnabledCaInfos​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken)
        Description copied from interface: CaSession
        Method returning info objects for all active CA's available to the system, i.e. not having status "external", uninitialized or "waiting for certificate response" and that the administrator is authorized to, Does not log access control to all CAs it checks, because this does not give access to the CAs but only returns CAInfo of CAs.
        Specified by:
        getAuthorizedAndEnabledCaInfos in interface CaSession
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - AuthenticationToken of admin
        Returns:
        a List<CAInfo> of authorized and enabled CAs

        public List<CAInfo> getAuthorizedAndNonExternalCaInfos​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken)
        Description copied from interface: CaSession
        Method returning info objects for all non-external CA's available to the system, i.e. not having status "external", and that the administrator is authorized to. Does not log access control to all CAs it checks, because this does not give access to the CAs but only returns CAInfo of CAs.
        Specified by:
        getAuthorizedAndNonExternalCaInfos in interface CaSession
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - AuthenticationToken of admin
        Returns:
        a List<CAInfo> of authorized and non-external CAs

      • getFutureRolloverCertificate

        public Certificate getFutureRolloverCertificate​(int caid)
                                         throws CADoesntExistsException
        Description copied from interface: CaSession
        Returns the future key/certificate rollover if a rollover is pending, or otherwise null.
        Specified by:
        getFutureRolloverCertificate in interface CaSession
        Parameters:
        caid - numerical unique id of CA
        Returns:
        Certificate
        Throws:
        CADoesntExistsException - If no CA with the given CA Id exists.
